uri.description: The URI of the configuration entity

port_number.description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface  RFC 2863 - ifIndex

description.description: A textual string containing information about the interface.  RFC 2863 - ifDescr

type.description: The type of interface  RFC 2863 - ifType

mtu.description: The size of the largest packet which can be sent/received on the interface, specified in octets RFC 2863 - ifMtu

speed.description: An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in bits per second  RFC 2863 - ifSpeed

physical_address.description: The interface's address at its protocol sub-layer.  RFC 2863 - ifPhysAddress

admin_status.description: The desired state of the interface. RFC 2863 -  ifAdminStatus

operational_status.description: The current operational state of the interface. RFC 2863 -  ifOperStatus

last_change.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time the interface entered its current operational state RFC 2863 - ifLastChange

in_octets.description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. RFC 2863 - ifInOctets

in_ucast_packets.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer. RFC 2863 -  ifInUcastPkts

in_discards.description: The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. RFC 2863 -  ifInDiscards

in_errors.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol RFC 2863 -  ifInErrors

in_unknown_proto.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. RFC 2863 -  ifInUnknownProtos

out_octets.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. RFC 2863 - ifOutOctets

out_ucast_packets.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. RFC 2863 - ifOutUcastPkts

out_discards.description: The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. RFC 2863 - ifOutDiscards

out_errors.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. RFC 2863 - ifOutErrors

name.description: The textual name of the interface. RFC 2863 - ifName

in_multicast_packets.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. RFC 2863 - ifInMulticastPkts

in_broadcast_packets.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer. RFC 2863 - ifInBroadcastPkts

out_multicast_packets.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. RFC 2863 - ifOutMulticastPkts

out_broadcast_packets.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. RFC 2863 - ifOutBroadcastPkts

hc_in_octets.description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. RFC 2863 - ifHCInOctets

hc_in_unicast_packets.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer. RFC 2863 - ifHCInUcastPkts

hc_in_multicast_packets.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. RFC 2863 - ifHCInMulticastPkts

hc_in_broadcast_packets.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer. RFC 2863 -  ifHCInBroadcastPkts

hc_out_octets.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. RFC 2863 -  ifHCOutOctets

hc_out_unicast_packets.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. RFC 2863 - ifHCOutUcastPkts

hc_out_multicast_packets.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. RFC 2863 - ifHCOutMulticastPkts

hc_out_broadcast_packets.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. RFC 2863 - ifHCOutBroadcastPkts

link_updown_trap.description: Indicates whether linkUp/linkDown traps should be generated for this interface. RFC 2863 - ifLinkUpDownTrapEnable

high_speed.description: An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second.  If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to `n+499,999'. RFC 2863 - ifHighSpeed

promiscuous_mode.description: This object has a value of false(2) if this interface only accepts packets/frames that are addressed to this station. This object has a value of true(1) when the station accepts all packets/frames transmitted on the media. RFC 2863 - ifPromiscuousMode

connector_present.description: This object has the value 'true(1)' if the interface sub layer has a physical connector and the value 'false(2)' otherwise. RFC 2863 - ifConnectorPresent

alias.description: This object is an 'alias' name for the interface as specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile 'handle' for the interface RFC 2863 - ifAlias

discontinuity_time.description: The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at which any one or more of this interface's counters suffered a discontinuity RFC 2863 - ifCounterDiscontinuityTime

poe_supported.description: This object has value 'true(1)' if poe is enable for interface and the value 'false(2) if poe is disabled forinterface

dsnoop_trusted_port.description: This object has value 'true(1) when interface is an dhcp snooping trusted port and the value 'false(1) when interface is an dhcp snooping untrusted port

in_fcs.description: A total number of frames received on a interface that are an integral number of octets in length but do not pass the FCS check.

in_alignment.description: The total number of frames received on a particular interface that are not an integral number of octets in length and do not pass the FCS check.

in_giant.description: The total number of packets received that were longer than 1518 octets excluding framing bits but including FCS octets and were otherwise well formed.

in_runt.description: The total number of packets received that were less than 64 octets long (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and were otherwise well formed.

out_collision.description: The total number of collision encountered during transmit.

out_late_collision.description: The number of times that a collision is detected on a particular interface later than one slotTime into the transmission of a packet.

out_excessive_collision.description: A count of frames for which transmission on a particular interface fails due to excessive collisions.

out_deferred.description: A total number of frames for which the first transmission attempt on a particular interface is delayed because the medium is busy.

in_jabbers.description: The total number of packets received that were longer than 1518 octets (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets), and had either a bad FCS or Alignment error.

in_fragmented.description: The total number of packets received that were less than 64 octets in length (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets) and had either a bad FCS or Alignment error.

out_queue_len.description: The length of the output packet queue (in packets).

avg_out_rate.description: Total average packets transmitted during 5 mins period.

avg_out_ucast_rate.description: Average unicast packet transmitted in pkts/sec

avg_out_bcast_rate.description: Average broadcast packet transmitted in pkts/sec

avg_out_mcast_rate.description: Average multicast packet transmitted in pkts/sec

avg_in_rate.description: Total average packets received during 5 mins period.

avg_in_ucast_rate.description: Average unicast packet received in pkts/sec

avg_in_bcast_rate.description: Average broadcast packet received in pkts/sec

avg_in_mcast_rate.description: Average multicast packet received in pkts/sec
